Generation III.Ruby: Crawdaunt has an extremely violent nature that compels it to challenge other living things to battle. Other life-forms refuse to live in ponds inhabited by this Pok é mon , making them desolate places.
Generation III.Sapphire: Crawdaunt molts (sheds) its shell regularly. Immediately after molting, its shell is soft and tender. Until the shell hardens, this Pok é mon hides in its streambed burrow to avoid attack from its foes.
Generation III.Emerald: A brutish Pok é mon that loves to battle. A veteran Crawdaunt that has prevailed in hundreds of battles has giant pincers marked with countless scars.
Generation III.FireRed: A rough customer that wildly flails its giant claws. It is said to be extremely hard to raise.
Generation III.LeafGreen: A rough customer that wildly flails its giant claws. It is said to be extremely hard to raise.

Generation IV.Diamond: It is a ruffian that uses its pincers to pick up and toss out other Pokémon from its pond.

Generation IV.Platinum: It is a ruffian that uses its pincers to pick up and toss out other Pokémon from its pond.

Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Its temperament is rough and it loves to fight, but as soon as its pincers break off, it turns cowardly. It stays timid until they grow back.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Its pincers often fall off. Unlike with Crabrawler or Clauncher, the meat in its claws is utterly nasty and stinking.
